Package com.cafean.jobstream.common.util

Class XMLUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.jobstream.common.util.XMLUtils
  • public final class XMLUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of static utility methods used to write XML directly.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void attribute​(java.io.PrintWriter out, java.lang.String attribute, java.lang.Object value)
      Outputs the given attribute/value pair as an XML attribute in a currently open tag.
      static boolean boolValue​(java.lang.String value, boolean defaultValue)
      Returns the boolean equivalent of the given string value with "true" and "yes" considered true and everything else false.
      static void closeTag​(java.io.PrintWriter out)
      Outputs the end of a self-contained tag: />
      static void closeTag​(java.io.PrintWriter out, java.lang.String tag, int indent)
      Outputs a closing tag for the given tag type in the for: <foo/>
      static void comment​(java.io.PrintWriter out, java.lang.String comment, int indent)
      Outputs the given comment as XML

      Returns the base indent level for XML files.

      Returns the third level indent amount for XML files.

      Converts the given boolean to either "yes" or "no"
      static java.lang.String wordWrapMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      sanitizes then word wraps the given plain text message using HTML tags and returns it
      static void writeXMLHeader​(java.io.PrintWriter out)
      writes out an XML version 1.0 header with UTF-8 encoding

      • openTag

        public static void openTag​(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                           java.lang.String tag,
                           int indent)
        Opens a new XML tag with the given tag name at the given indent level. For example: "<foo"
        Parameters:
        out - the PrintWriter to write the tag to
        tag - a String containing the name of the tag to write
        indent - the base indent for the tag

      • openTag

        public static void openTag​(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                           java.lang.String tag,
                           int indent,
                           boolean empty)
        Opens a new XML tag with the given tag name at the given indent level.

        For example: <foo

        If empty is specified it would be: <foo>

        Parameters:
        out - the PrintWriter to write the tag to
        tag - a String containing the name of the tag to write
        indent - the base indent for the tag
        empty - if true the closing ">" will be included

      • closeTag

        public static void closeTag​(java.io.PrintWriter out)
        Outputs the end of a self-contained tag: />

      • closeTag

        public static void closeTag​(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                            java.lang.String tag,
                            int indent)
        Outputs a closing tag for the given tag type in the for: <foo/>

      • textTag

        public static void textTag​(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                           java.lang.String tag,
                           java.lang.String contents,
                           int indent)
        Outputs a text-only tag that contains no attributes and the sanitized version of the given text contents.

        For example: <foo>Text Content</foo>

        See Also:
        sanitize(java.lang.Object)

      • attribute

        public static void attribute​(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                             java.lang.String attribute,
                             java.lang.Object value)
        Outputs the given attribute/value pair as an XML attribute in a currently open tag. If the given value is null then the resulting attribute value will be empty.
        Parameters:
        out - the PrintWriter that attribute will be written to
        attribute - a String containing the name of the attribute
        value - an Object referring to the value of the attribute

      • sanitize

        public static java.lang.String sanitize​(java.lang.Object value)
        Returns a sanitized version of the toString() of the given value

      • sanitize

        public static java.lang.String sanitize​(java.lang.Object value,
                                        boolean whitespace)
        Returns a sanitized version of the toString() of the given value

      • sanitizeHTML

        public static java.lang.String sanitizeHTML​(java.lang.String value)
        Returns a sanitized version of the toString() of the given value

                           java.lang.String comment,
                           int indent)
        Outputs the given comment as XML

        public static java.lang.String toYesNo​(boolean value)
        Converts the given boolean to either "yes" or "no"

      • boolValue

        public static boolean boolValue​(java.lang.String value,
                                boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the boolean equivalent of the given string value with "true" and "yes" considered true and everything else false.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the value returned if value is null

                           int defaultValue)
        Returns the integer equivalent of the given string value
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the value returned if value is null
